qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court and Norwood, Unionville, Court, what is the gender of the defendants G. Torres and C. Taylor?
qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court, the defendant G. Torres is female; according to the judgment of Norwood, Unionville, Court, the defendant C. Taylor is female.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court and Norwood, Unionville, Court, what are the birthdates of the defendants G. Torres and C. Taylor?
qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court, the defendant G. Torres was born on 11th November 1960; according to the judgment of Norwood, Unionville, Court, the defendant C. Taylor was born on 19th October 1960.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court and Norwood, Unionville, Court, what are the occupations of the defendants G. Torres and C. Taylor?
qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court, the defendant G. Torres is an Elementary School Teacher; according to the judgment of Norwood, Unionville, Court, the defendant C. Taylor is a Retail Shop Owner.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court and Norwood, Unionville, Court, what are the residences of the defendants G. Torres and C. Taylor?
qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court, the defendant G. Torres resides at 10, Ashton street, Bayside; according to the judgment of Norwood, Unionville, Court, the defendant C. Taylor resides at 71, Yorkshire street, Unionville.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court and Norwood, Unionville, Court, what crimes did the defendants G. Torres and C. Taylor commit respectively?

content: Based on the evidence presented and the legal arguments made, this court finds G. Torres guilty of the Crime of Traffic Accident as per Article No. 133.

In view of the overwhelming evidence, the severity of the offense, and the considerations detailed above, this court finds C. Taylor guilty of the crime of Selling Counterfeit Registered Trademark Goods under Article No. 214.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court, the defendant G. Torres committed the Crime of Traffic Accident; according to the judgment of Norwood, Unionville, Court, the defendant C. Taylor committed the Crime of Selling Counterfeit Registered Trademark Goods.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court and Norwood, Unionville, Court, what are the judgment dates for the cases involving G. Torres and C. Taylor?

content: This judgment is delivered and executed on this 10th day of January 2023, by the Norwood, Unionville Court, with the presence and consent of the Chief Judge T. Robinson, Judge N. Cook, and Court Clerk O. Murphy.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court, the judgment date for the case involving G. Torres is 20th April 2023; according to the judgment of Norwood, Unionville, Court, the judgment date for the case involving C. Taylor is 10th January 2023.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the judgment of Vandalia, Bayside, Court and Norwood, Unionville, Court, what sentences were given to the defendants G. Torres and C. Taylor?

content: Consequently, this court sentences G. Torres to four years of fixed-term imprisonment.
The defendant is hereby sentenced to four years of fixed-term imprisonment and fined $100,000 for illicit gains.

Torres was sentenced to four years of fixed-term imprisonment; according to the judgment of Norwood, Unionville, Court, the defendant C. Taylor was sentenced to four years of fixed-term imprisonment and fined $100,000 for illicit gains.
